title: Early trade deadline questions: What's next for Giannis, Lakers and top contenders?
content: Early NBA trade deadline questions for Bucks, Lakers, Warriors and other top contenders, including biggest needs and what they can pull off.

title: Jimmy Butler, Steve Kerr and the Warriors' quest to solve the Jonathan Kuminga puzzle
content: Butler has taken on a mentorship role with Kuminga, who is still trying to find his role with the Warriors.

title: UConn 'got punked' as Arizona overwhelms in paint
content: Arizona flipped the script on UConn in their top-five matchup, taking advantage of senior center Tarris Reed Jr.'s absence to win a physical battle in the paint during a 71-67 victory.

title: Hurts unfazed by reports Eagles frustrated with QB
content: Eagles quarterback Jalen Hurts, responding to recent reports that some players have grown frustrated with his play, says he will "never run away" from holding himself accountable.

title: Braves retain Iglesias, deal for Gold Glover Dubon
content: The Braves retained veteran closer Raisel Iglesias on a one-year, $16 million deal and acquired two-time Gold Glove winner Mauricio Dubon from the Astros.

title: Jets' Boyd: 'Starting to breathe on my own now'
content: Jets cornerback Kris Boyd, who was shot in the abdomen early Sunday morning outside a Manhattan restaurant, is now in stable condition and "starting to breathe on my own now," he said Wednesday.

title: Terps get Oladotun, Williams' 1st 5-star since '17
content: Babatunde Oladotun, ranked No. 8 in the SC Next 100 for the class of 2026, committed to Maryland on Wednesday, giving coach Buzz WIlliams his first five-star recruit in nearly a decade.

title: Top seeds now set for World Cup draw, playoffs
content: The top-seeded teams for the Dec. 5 World Cup tournament draw, including Germany but not Croatia, were set Wednesday when FIFA published new rankings.

title: Rodgers: Playing status will be 'a safety thing'
content: To play Sunday against the Bears, Steelers quarterback Aaron Rodgers said he has to be able to "protect" himself.

title: Lamar on injury report again, this time for ankle
content: For the second straight week, Lamar Jackson didn't practice for the Ravens on Wednesday. This time, the two-time NFL MVP is listed with an ankle injury.

title: ðŸ“¸ Cardi B, Stefon Diggs share photo of newborn
content: The Grammy Award-winning artist and girlfriend of the New England Patriots wide receiver announced their child's birth on Instagram.

content: The Eagles' head coach is 56-22 over five seasons, including two trips to the Super Bowl. Yet he's constantly under the microscope. Why?

content: The Wildcats added another statement win to their early-season rÃ©sumÃ©, headlining this week's top-25 risers.

content: From the Players Era in Las Vegas to Bahamas tournaments, the next 10 days are filled with big nonconference games.

content: Why Travis Hunter, Jeremiah Smith and Caitlin Clark have custom shoes from this Houston Christian freshman.

content: Stingley has 14 interceptions since 2022, but he doesn't want to talk about them. He is much more interested in the plays he almost made.

content: Will the best pitcher in baseball be on the move this offseason? Those in the game offer their advice.

content: L.A.'s blueprint to bolster a two-time defending champion will be among MLB's biggest stories this winter.

content: Some of our wild takes from September don't look so wild anymore. Others are way off base. Here's an update.

content: Even Jonathan Taylor can't do it all by himself. Fantasy managers have a role to play too.  Here's what to do.

title: The Playbook: Lineup locks, Shadow Reports for Week 12
content: An all-encompassing look at matchups to exploit or avoid and lineup locks in fantasy, as well as projected scores.

title: NWSL faces litmus test to retain Trinity Rodman's star power
content: Trinity Rodman represents some of the very best that the NWSL has to offer. That's why Saturday's NWSL Championship -- perhaps her final game -- feels so significant.

title: Why we're about to find out if Al Davis was right about Lane Kiffin
content: In different circumstances, Kiffin could -- maybe even should -- leave Ole Miss. But not these circumstances.

title: Expert picks, best bets: How Tsarukyan can reenter title contention
content: MMA experts give their predictions for a UFC Fight Night from Doha, Qatar, headlined by lightweight contenders Arman Tsarukyan and Dan Hooker.

title: Bradley's take: Can Haney avoid Norman's left hook?
content: Timothy Bradley Jr. breaks down the Brian Norman Jr.-Devin Haney title fight, and shares his thoughts on how the fight could play out.

title: The running man: Odds are Josh Allen makes QB TD history on Thursday night
content: The Buffalo Bills' MVP is one rushing TD away from becoming the NFL's all-time leader in rushing TDs by a QB. Will he get it Thursday?

title: Don't be surprised if ... Lauri Markkanen averages 30 PPG all season
content: Eric Karabell forecasts what to expect from Lauri Markannen, two Pelicans rookies and a number of Celtics' scorers in the months ahead.

title: 2026 World Cup playoff draw: Who will fill the final six spots?
content: Six spots remain up for grabs at the 2026 World Cup, with four to emerge from Europe and a further two from an intercontinental playoff. What's the draw, and who will advance? We make our picks.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United eye highly rated Rennes duo
content: Manchester United are keeping tabs on Rennes duo JÃ©rÃ©my Jacquet and Mohamed Meite. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Rajasthan Electoral Roll Supervisor Dies After Chest Pain, Family Alleges Work Pressure
content: A supervisor engaged in the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of electoral rolls in Rajasthan died after complaining of chest pains in Karauli, with family members alleging he had been under severe pressure due to the ongoing drive, officials said.

title: "Mamdani Is Indian": Mehdi Hasan Schools Eric Trump Over Anti-India Claim
content: British-American journalist Mehdi Hasan sharply criticised US President Donald Trump's son, Eric Trump, after he made sweeping allegations about New York City mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani, accusing him of anti-Indian and antisemitic attitudes.

title: To Ease Wait, 2 Lutyens' Bungalows To Be Designated Official Residence Of Chief Justice
content: Seeking to ensure that chief justices of India do not have to wait for accommodation after they take charge, the Supreme Court registry has decided to have two bungalows designated as the official residence of the country's top judge.

title: 3 Killed After Pick-Up Van Collides With Speeding Train In Tripura: Cops
content: Three persons were killed in a collision between a pick-up van and a speeding train in Tripura's Dhalai district on Thursday, police said.

title: US Has New Plan To End Ukraine War, It Echoes Moscow's Demands: What To Know
content: The United States has presented a plan to Ukraine with a list of sweeping concessions Kyiv could make to potentially end the war with Russia, a proposal that appears to echo many of Moscow's maximalist demands.

title: Rifts Deepen In INDIA Bloc After Bihar Rout, Key Allies Weigh Exit Options
content: The INDIA alliance is grappling with its most serious internal rupture yet after its crushing defeat in Bihar, with several regional partners openly questioning the Congress-led coalition's strategy, leadership and credibility.

title: TCS, Private Equity Major To Invest Rs 18,000 Crore In Data Centre Business
content: The country's largest IT services company TCS announced a tie-up with private equity major TPG for its upcoming data centre business, in which both the partners aim to invest Rs 18,000 crore.

title: Rs 2.36 Crore Fines, 48 Construction Sites Shut: How Delhi Is Battling Dust
content: The Delhi government has imposed Rs 2.36 crore in fines, issued over 200 show-cause notices, and ordered closure of 48 construction sites for violating dust-control norms over the past month.

title: Mumbai Civic Body Deploys Flying Squads To Improve Air Pollution Control
content: Amid pollution concerns, Mumbai's civic body, the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC), has deployed flying squads across all administrative wards to tighten enforcement of its 28-point air pollution control guidelines.

title: Search For Water Ice On Moon's South Pole To See India-Japan Collaboration
content: India and Japan are preparing among the most ambitious space missions of this decade - a joint lunar exploration that could change the way humanity looks at the Moon.

title: Iran Seeks Saudi Help To Revive Nuclear Talk With US
content: Iran has asked Saudi Arabia to persuade the US to revive stalled nuclear talks, underlining Tehran's anxiety over a possible repeat of Israeli airstrikes and its deepening economic issues, two regional sources with knowledge of the matter said.

title: Pope Leo XIV Asks Italian Church To Develop 'Culture Of Abuse Prevention'
content: Pope Leo XIV called on the Italian Church to develop a "culture of prevention" on clerical child sex abuse, after criticisms that it has been slow to respond to the global crisis.

title: Fresh Assets Worth Over Rs 1,400 Crore Attached In Case Against Anil Ambani
content: The Enforcement Directorate on Thursday said it has attached fresh assets worth more than Rs 1,452 crore in connection with the bank fraud cases against businessman Anil Ambani's Reliance Group.

title: 'Get A Fevikwik': Parents Say Meerut Doctor Sealed Toddler's Wound With Rs 5 Glue
content: The family of a two-and-a-half-year-old boy from Meerut claimed that a private hospital used Fevikwik to seal his wound instead of stitching it.

title: Kashmir Times Office Raided In Jammu, AK-47 Cartridges Found: Police
content: The State Investigation Agency (SIA) of the Jammu & Kashmir Police on Thursday raided the office of the Kashmir Times in Jammu for allegedly promoting activities against the country.

title: Red Fort Gears Up For Its First Mega Event Post Blast, Security Heightened
content: As the Red Fort prepares to host a mega event commemorating the 350th death anniversary of Guru Tegh Bahadur, just weeks after a blast in its vicinity, the Delhi Police has heightened security measures.

title: Tamil Nadu Student Dies Month After Suicide Attempt, Family Blames Teachers: Cops
content: A Class IX student of a government school here, who allegedly attempted suicide a month ago, died at Coimbatore Medical College Hospital, police said.

title: Parents Of 2 Students Who Died By Suicide To NDTV On What Their Schools Did
content: The father of a Class 10 student who died by suicide in Delhi, leaving behind a note blaming teachers for harassment, told NDTV they were about to change school after Class 10 and his son was looking forward to it.

title: Ex-Temple Body Chief Arrested In Sabarimala Gold Theft Case
content: The Special Investigation Team on Thursday arrested former Travancore Devaswom Board president A Padmakumar in the Sabarimala gold theft case, officials said. He was the Devaswom Board president in 2019, when the gold theft took place.

title: Watch: Donald Trump's Son Visits Taj Mahal
content: Donald Trump Jr., son of US President Donald Trump, visited the Taj Mahal in Agra on Thursday and spent nearly an hour exploring the monument under an elaborate security arrangement, officials said.

title: 'We can wait': India is playing it cool on trade deal with US; what's its edge?
content: India is negotiating with the US from a position of strength, with its economy robust and export declines to America less severe than anticipated. Despite US tariffs, India's "ready to wait" approach allows it to push for favorable terms, while exporters are supported by trade deals and domestic measures.

title: Watch: CM Nitish tries to touch PM's feet at Patna airport; RJD shares video
content: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar was seen attempting to touch Prime Minister Narendra Modi's feet at Patna airport before the PM's departure. This marks a recurring gesture from Kumar, who has previously shown similar deference to Modi on multiple occasions. The incident occurred shortly after Kumar's swearing-in for his tenth term as chief minister.

title: Delhi blast: Lockers of docs in J&K searched; 'white collar' terror module under lens
content: Authorities intensified searches across hospitals and media offices in Jammu and Kashmir, probing links between medical staff, extremist modules, and fugitive operatives following the Delhi blast. Recoveries of arms and explosives from a "white-collar" terror module have fueled the investigation, with a media house also raided for alleged anti-national content.

title: Bazball reaches its endgame; Eng's hopes hinge on raw pace to recreate Bodyline
content: England enter the Ashes with their quickest pace attack in decades and a matured Bazball philosophy, aiming to end a 15-year drought in Australia. With Mark Wood, Jofra Archer and a battery of genuine quicks, Ben Stokesâ€™ side arrives believing speed can break the long-standing barrier. For Bazball, this is the defining series: victory brings vindication, defeat invites its fiercest scrutiny yet.

title: Microsoft on AI criticism: Mustafa Suleyman supports Windows head; â€˜so many cynicsâ€™
content: Microsoft's AI CEO, Mustafa Suleyman, defended the company's AI advancements against user criticism, comparing current capabilities to 1990s mobile games.  This defense comes as users express frustration over intrusive AI features like Copilot in Windows, citing bugs and privacy concerns.  Suleyman also voiced caution regarding Artificial Superintelligence, advocating for a 'humanist superintelligence' instead.

title: Self-employment is creating most new jobs in India: What this means for job seekers
content: Self-employment has emerged as the fastest-growing segment in Indiaâ€™s labour market, rising from 23.9 crore in FY18 to 35.8 crore in FY24. It now accounts for over half of Indiaâ€™s total employment, with growth seen across both farm and non-farm sectors. Students and young professionals are exploring opportunities in freelancing, digital services, traditional businesses, and agricultural entrepreneurship. The trend highlights the need for skill development, entrepreneurial preparedness, and supportive policies to sustain independent work as formal jobs grow slowly.

title: Talaak-e-Hasan explained: Why itâ€™s under scrutiny, and how it differs from triple talaq
content: The Supreme Court questioned the validity of Muslim men authorizing lawyers to issue Talaq-e-Hasan notices, deeming it a practice that leaves women vulnerable. The bench stressed that divorce requires the husband's direct pronouncement and signature, not delegation to third parties. This judicial scrutiny brings renewed attention to the constitutional validity of this divorce method.

title: Who's best No.4 Test batter? Not Kohli, Sachin or Lara; Ponting picks this cricketer
content: The former Australian men's cricket team captain chose fellow countryman Steve Smith over Miandad. He then picked Steve Smith over West Indies legend Brian Lara, and former South African all-rounder Jacques Kallis. Then put forward with a tough of choosing between Steve Smith and Virat Kohli, Ponting went with Smith. Then he also chose Smith over England batter Joe Root.

title: Jeff Bezos warns of recession: Amazon founder issues caution
content: Amazon founder Jeff Bezos is urging consumers and businesses to delay major purchases amid growing recession fears. He advises households to save for big-ticket items like cars and appliances, while small businesses should avoid large capital expenditures.  Despite this caution, Bezos remains optimistic about the long-term American Dream and future space travel accessibility.

title: Air combat: Russia makes big Su-57 offer to India; what's on the table
content: Russia has offered India unrestricted technology transfer for its Su-57 fifth-generation fighter jets, including production and licensing for critical components. This significant defence partnership aims to bolster India's future fighter aircraft needs, ensuring domestic manufacturing capabilities and long-term upgrades, reinforcing over six decades of cooperation ahead of President Putin's visit.

title: Raid on Kashmir Times office: Cops recover AK rifle cartridges, bullets; editors react
content: Jammu and Kashmir Police's State Investigation Agency raided the Jammu office of Kashmir Times. Officials stated the publication was involved in activities against the country. The search recovered AK rifle cartridges, pistol rounds, and hand-grenade pins. The newspaper management called the allegations baseless and an attempt to "silence independent journalism."

title: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella to employees: Must rapidly rethink AI
content: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella has appointed Rolf Harms, the executive behind the influential 2010 "Economics of the Cloud" white paper, to help rethink Microsoft's business model for the AI era. In an internal memo obtained by Business Insider, Nadella emphasized the need to rapidly transform the company's approach to AI economics, similar to its cloud computing pivot 15 years ago. The move reflects Nadella's concerns about Microsoft's survival in the AI era, as he warned employees that some of the company's biggest businesses may become irrelevant without fundamental changes.

title: Smriti Mandhana flaunts ring; confirms engagement in dance with teammates - watch
content: Indian cricket star Smriti Mandhana has officially announced her engagement to music composer Palash Muchhal through a fun Instagram reel with teammates. The World Cup winner showcased her ring, confirming weeks of speculation. Muchhal was also in attendance for the World Cup final against South Africa. This personal milestone follows Mandhana's stellar performance in India's historic World Cup victory.

title: More pitch trouble? Bowling coach ahead of 2nd Test - 'If they cut the grass... '
content: South Africa's bowling coach, Piet Botha, is uncertain about the grass on the Guwahati pitch for the second Test, but anticipates better batting conditions than Kolkata's unpredictable surface. He expects moisture to aid the new ball in the opening hour, with toss decisions hinging on the wicket's final appearance. South Africa is also monitoring Kagiso Rabada's fitness.

title: Is John Tavares playing vs Blue Jackets? Maple Leafs injury update
content: Toronto Maple Leafs captain John Tavares remains a focal point ahead of tonightâ€™s matchup against the Columbus Blue Jackets at Scotiabank Arena. With both teams looking to gain momentum, Tavaresâ€™ availability could shape the outcome, especially with Torontoâ€™s offense driving their early-season success. Hereâ€™s the latest update on whether Tavares will be in the lineup for this key Eastern Conference clash.

title: Candace Owens drops explosive claim on Charlie Kirk â€˜assassinationâ€™
content: Candace Owens questions the official narrative surrounding Charlie Kirk's shooting, suggesting a planned setup involving multiple individuals. She claims Tyler Robinson's role was limited, with his fingerprints not being the only ones on the weapon. Owens also alleges Lance Twiggs played a more significant, albeit different, part in the incident, citing a TMZ video as evidence.

title: Video sparks allegations of Trevon Diggsâ€™ role in violent elevator encounter
content: Surveillance footage has surfaced regarding an elevator altercation in Los Angeles, allegedly involving individuals connected to the Diggs family. While Trevon Diggs isn't officially charged, a civil suit names him, and his brother Darez has faced legal action. The victim claims robbery and assault, sparking intense scrutiny.

title: Analysts frustrated with Nylander as Leafs lead without Auston Matthews
content: William Nylander faces criticism for his inconsistent play as he leads the Toronto Maple Leafs in Auston Matthews' absence. Analysts question his commitment to a two-way game, citing recent defensive lapses. Despite strong offensive numbers, his impact is under scrutiny. The team's defensive struggles are also a major concern, with forwards expected to contribute more defensively.

title: The right time to eat dinner in winter for better digestion and sleep
content: Winter's shorter days disrupt circadian rhythms, impacting metabolism and sleep. Research indicates that eating dinner earlier, ideally between 5:30 pm and 7:00 pm, significantly improves blood sugar control and digestion. Shifting calories to earlier meals and opting for lighter evening fare supports overall well-being during colder months.

title: 'Guv's can't sit on bills but ... ': What SC said on presidential reference - key points
content: Governors cannot indefinitely delay Bills passed by state legislatures, the Supreme Court ruled, emphasizing cooperative federalism. However, courts cannot set hard deadlines for governors or the President on Bills, nor can they grant 'deemed assent' or compel the President to seek judicial opinions. The ruling clarifies the limits of judicial intervention while upholding constitutional accountability.

title: Jobs, crime & funds: What Nitish must fix in his 10th term - explained
content: Nitish Kumar begins his 10th term as Bihar CM, facing significant challenges in job creation, stemming migration, and funding ambitious welfare promises. He must also restore his 'Sushasan Babu' image by improving law and order, while navigating complex political alliances. This term is crucial for Bihar's progress.

title: Cardi B inspires Stefon Diggs as Patriots WR battles painful ACL recovery
content: Stefon Diggs' remarkable comeback from a season-ending ACL tear is bolstered by girlfriend Cardi B's unwavering support.  Despite admitting to feeling "broken" during grueling rehab, Diggs impressed with an eight-and-a-half-month recovery, surpassing typical timelines.  Now signed with the Patriots, his journey highlights the crucial role of mental resilience and personal encouragement in professional sports.

title: 'No one wanted': Batting coach contradicts Gambhir; hits out at Kolkata wicket
content: India's batting coach Sitanshu Kotak strongly defended head coach Gautam Gambhir against criticism following the Kolkata Test loss to South Africa. "'Gautam Gambhir, Gautam Gambhir' (criticism) is being done. I am saying this because I am a staff and I feel bad. That's not the way," Kotak said on Thursday ahead of the second Test starting Saturday.

title: How Anti-India hate went mainstream in America - offline and online
content: A community once welcomed as quiet achievers is now facing a bipartisan backlash, as anti-India hate jumps from online narratives to real-world hostility in a country still misreading Indians five centuries after Columbus.

title: Another TACO? Trump admin may delay long-promised semiconductor tariffs
content: The Trump administration may delay imposing promised semiconductor tariffs, signaling a cautious approach to avoid provoking China and disrupting rare earth mineral supplies. While the White House denies a policy shift, reports suggest a potential postponement amid domestic concerns over rising consumer prices and a fragile trade truce with Beijing.

title: 5 signs you are not healthy, according to a top doc
content: Dr. William Li highlights five critical bodily signs often ignored until they become severe. These include blood in stool, saliva, urine, on the skin without injury, and abnormal vaginal bleeding. Prompt medical attention for these symptoms is vital for early detection and potentially life-saving treatment, as they can indicate serious conditions like cancer.

title: Delhi blast case: Shaheen among 4 accused sent to 10-day NIA custody
content: Four individuals, including doctors from Pulwama and Saharanpur, have been remanded to 10 days NIA custody in connection with the Red Fort blast. Investigators believe they played a significant role in planning and executing the attack, which claimed 15 lives. The probe has expanded internationally, involving Saudi Arabia, Maldives, and Turkey.

title: SIR battle in Bengal: Mamata writes to CEC; calls survey 'chaotic, dangerous'
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee has described the ongoing Special Intensive Revision as "unplanned, chaotic, and dangerous," citing the deaths of multiple booth-level officers. She expressed grave concerns to the CEC about the alarming situation, alleging a lack of preparedness and pushing BLOs beyond human limits, risking voter roll credibility.

title: Olivia Dunne opens up about training through injury for SI cover
content: Olivia Dunne revealed her pre-Sports Illustrated Swimsuit 2025 shoot workout, focusing on glute-strengthening exercises like lunges and hip thrusts. Despite a recent kneecap fracture, she completed the Bermuda shoot, feeling confident in her chosen bikini. This marks her third consecutive SI appearance, highlighting her growing self-assurance and inspiring other athletes.

title: Delhi blast: Red Fort gears up for first mega event; Prez Murmu & Shah may attend
content: The historic Red Fort is set to host a major event commemorating the 350th death anniversary of Guru Tegh Bahadur, with security significantly heightened following a recent car blast. The three-day kirtan darbar, expected to draw nearly 50,000 attendees including dignitaries, will feature a multi-layer security grid and enhanced surveillance.

title: Chip race: Semiconductor sector will be on par with US by 2032, says Vaishnaw
content: India aims to rival global chipmaking leaders like the US and China within a decade, with plans advancing rapidly. The government's $10 billion incentive scheme is foundational, fostering manufacturing, assembly, and design capacity. By 2031-2032, India expects to achieve parity with current global leaders, leveraging its engineering talent and design capabilities.

title: Top neuroscientist reveals the best supplement for brain health, that also improves sleep
content: Neuroscientist Robert Love highlights magnesium as a crucial supplement for optimal brain health and sleep.  This essential mineral supports hundreds of biochemical reactions vital for cognition, memory, and focus.  Magnesium threonate and glycinate are recommended forms for enhancing brain function and promoting restful sleep.

title: 'Intellectual terrorists more dangerous': Cops on Delhi 2020 riots; flag worrying trend
content: Delhi Police informed the Supreme Court that "intellectuals becoming terrorists" pose a greater danger. They argued that activists Umar Khalid and Sharjeel Imam, among others, are using trial delays to their advantage. The police presented evidence of "inflammatory speeches" and alleged the riots were timed with Donald Trump's visit to spark nationwide unrest and achieve "regime change."

title: Gold and silver ETFs losing shine â€” Should you buy on dip or hold back?
content: Gold and silver ETFs experienced a significant downturn, with gold down over 6% and silver nearly 9%. Experts advise a long-term perspective and systematic investment plans (SIPs) to navigate volatility. While gold is seen as a debt alternative, silver's long-term potential is viewed as weaker. Despite recent dips, both metals show strong historical returns.

title: Crisis in Pakistan cricket! Former cricketer resigns from selection panel
content: Former Pakistan Test captain Azhar Ali has stepped down from the national selection committee and head of youth development at the Pakistan's National Cricket Academy. He resigned after Sarfaraz Ahmed was given full control of the Pakistan Shaheens and under-19 teams. Azhar reportedly grew frustrated with the board's functioning and proposals not being advanced.

title: Ex-NFL star Antonio Brown investigated for attempted murder
content: Former NFL star Antonio Brown emerged from a Miami correctional center, facing attempted murder charges. Prosecutors and his defense attorney expressed doubts about the alleged victim being shot, potentially impacting the case. Brown, who pleaded not guilty, was granted house arrest with a GPS monitor, allowing him to work and support his seven children.

title: Technical snag hits IndiGo: Guwahatiâ€“Delhi flight delayed by three hours
content: Passengers on IndiGo flight 6E 930 from Guwahati to Delhi faced a significant three-hour delay on Thursday due to a technical snag. Engineers identified the issue, grounding the aircraft at Lokpriya Gopinath Bordoloi International Airport. The airline is offering refreshments and options for refunds or rebooking.

title: IND vs SA | 'Already drink tea during lunch': Sudharsan reacts to change for 2nd Test
content: Team India and South Africa will adopt an unusual practice for the second Test in Guwahati, with play starting 30 minutes early and tea preceding lunch. This adjustment is to accommodate the North East's early daylight window. Players like Sai Sudharsan and Keshav Maharaj are open to the change, while Aiden Markram expresses a preference for the traditional routine.

title: 'Sorry mom': 10th student jumps to death; massive protest outside Delhi school
content: A 16-year-old student died by suicide, leaving a note alleging harassment by teachers. The note, found in his school bag, detailed his distress and requested action against the educators. His father's FIR corroborates the claims of continuous mental torment over minor issues, prompting protests by students and parents demanding accountability.

title: Fresh Gen-Z protests erupt in Nepal: Clashes in Bara, Simara; curfew imposed
content: Gen Z demonstrators clashed with police in Nepal's Bara district for a second day, leading to a curfew imposition. Tensions escalated after an alleged attack on youths by CPN-UML cadres, with Gen Z demanding arrests and vowing to keep the district closed. Interim Prime Minister Sushila Karki urged restraint ahead of the 2026 elections.

title: Bihar: 4 of 5 seats with max & min SIR deletions won by NDA; why EC datasets donâ€™t fit into pattern
content: While women's turnout significantly boosted the NDA's Bihar victory, AIMIM secured three of the top five seats with highest female participation. The special revision exercise's impact on poll outcomes showed mixed results, with NDA winning a proportional share of seats affected by deletions and additions.

title: Sundar Pichai says AI could replace him: Is the CEO 'easier' to automate?
content: Google CEO Sundar Pichai foresees AI taking over complex tasks, even his own job, within a year. This aligns with other tech leaders like OpenAI's Sam Altman, though Nvidia's CEO disagrees. While AI excels at data-driven decisions and strategy modeling, human judgment, trust-building, and ethical reasoning remain irreplaceable leadership qualities.

title: 4 early warning signs of colorectal cancer that appear in poop
content: Colorectal cancer is a serious health issue, affecting more young people. Early detection is vital for survival. Changes in stool, like thinness, mucus, or blood, can be warning signs. Persistent changes in bowel habits also require attention. Lifestyle factors contribute to the rising risk. Prompt medical evaluation is essential.

title: Indiaâ€™s playing XI puzzle: No Gill, Sudharsan, NKR in mix; Axar Patel likely to sit out
content: India have been dealt a significant setback ahead of the second Test in Guwahati, with captain Shubman Gill ruled out due to lack of match fitness. Despite travelling with the squad and showing signs of improvement, the BCCI medical team has advised against risking him, forcing India to rethink their Playing XI combinations for the must-win game.

title: Gold price today: How much the yellow metal costs in your city? Check rates
content: Gold and silver prices saw a decline in futures trade as the US Federal Reserve's meeting minutes indicated continued caution regarding interest rate cuts. Analysts noted that market uncertainty increased following the unexpected cancellation of the October employment report, impacting rate-cut expectations and strengthening the Dollar Index.

title: Signature 'gamcha' returns: PM Modiâ€™s wave steals show in Patna - Watch
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi was seen waving his signature gamcha at Nitish Kumar's swearing-in ceremony in Patna, marking the latter's record 10th term as Bihar Chief Minister. PM Modi congratulated the new government and thanked the people of Bihar for the NDA's significant mandate.

title: Jaishankar meets Talibanâ€™s Industry and Commerce Minister Azizi
content: Discussed ways to strengthen our trade, connectivity and people to people ties, says External Affairs Minister

title: Kerala HC seeks steps to prevent vlogging inside driver compartment of moving buses, lorries
content: Motor vehicles that flouted safety standards in this manner, posing threat to the safety of passengers and other road users must be penalised, says HC

title: Telangana will establish Indiaâ€™s first North East Annexe, says Chief Minister Revanth Reddy
content: The festival was designed to celebrate cultural unity and strengthen ties between Telangana and the North Eastern states, it represented a bond that had long been overlooked, the Chief Minister said

title: Indiaâ€™s annual maximum temperatures increased across most States from 0.1Â°C to 0.5Â°C during last decade: Report
content: This persistent warming has directly translated into record-breaking electricity demand, reaching around 250 GW during the summer of 2024, largely due to surging cooling needs across residential, commercial, and industrial sectors, the report points out

title: ED files supplementary prosecution complaint against Robert Vadra in Sanjay Bhandari case
content: The evidence gathered by the ED indicates that the property acquired by Sanjay Bhandari was â€˜beneficially used by Robert Vadraâ€™

title: Amoebic encephalitis claims one more life in Kerala
content: 26-year-old woman, a native of Nedumangadu, had developed fever and headache in the first week of October

title: Padmakumarâ€™s arrest renders the government vulnerable to criticism from the Congress and the BJP.
content: The Congress and the BJP have sought to push the arrest of Padmakumar and, earlier, former Devaswom Commissioner N. Vasu, both CPI(M)â€™s political appointees, to the top of their election rhetoric in the spirited campaigning for the local body polls in December

title: Global summit will focus on democratising AI, says Safirulla
content: At the India AI Impact Summit, which will be hosted by New Delhi in Feb. 2026, global tech leaders will also address issues surrounding the fear of job losses and equipping job-seekers to meet the needs of the changing job market, says the director, IndiaAI Mission

title: Family of three murdered accuses police of failing to arrest accused
content: BJP says political influence shielding accused Vijay Halli and Shankar Allolli who are close associates of Minister Priyank Kharge

title: Police hunt for 5 declared foreigners in Assam given 24 hours to leave India
content: The five, all Muslims, were adjudged non-citizens by a Foreignersâ€™ Tribunal in Sonitpur district on October 24

title: Kharif paddy procurement hits a new high this season in Andhra Pradesh
content: As of November 20, a quantum of 3,49,061 tonnes of paddy has been procured, which is the highest among the last three seasons, says official

title: India seeks energy security of island nations, pitches for solar power
content: Environment Minister Bhupender Yadav said the island nations face â€œunique vulnerabilities due to their dependence on imported fossil fuels, climate-related disruptions and fragile infrastructureâ€

title: Haveri surgeon says infant died in its motherâ€™s womb
content: An independent inquiry has been initiated into the case of precipitated labour, according to P.R. Havanoor

title: Passenger information system, QR code ready for launch in city
content: It is part of the phased rollout of BUSZ, an advanced mobility solution for transforming public transport with smart solutions

title: Arrest of former TDB president Padmakumar raises new questions
content: Information has emerged that the initial application regarding the gold, submitted by Unnikrishnan Potti , was received not by the TDB but the Devaswom department  under Kadakampally Surendran

title: Activists demand statehood for North Karnataka to become prosperous
content: â€˜Successive governments have neglected the region and the only way for growth is by attaining statehoodâ€™

title: Defections across parties roil pre-poll scene in Kozhikode district
content: Long-time party workers from multiple political fronts are on the list of persons who recently quit their parent organisations after disagreements over candidate selection

title: In Vyttila, face-off between defectors in three-cornered contest
content: Both the Left Democratic Front and the United Democratic Front have fielded candidates who defected from rival parties; R. Sakhil is contesting as the Bharatiya Janata Party candidate

title: Groom, parents arrested in child marriage case in Guntur
content: Action will be initiated against the girlâ€™s grandmother and the church pastor who solemnised the marriage of the minor, say police

title: Legal heirs have lawful right to seek transfer of arms licence and firearm sans any threat to life: Karnataka High Court
content: The police cannot refuse to transfer arms licence to the legal heir of an licence holder for the reason that there is â€œno threat to lifeâ€ to the heir when the Arms Rules, 2016, which has a specific provision for transferring arms licence, does not prescribe it as a condition, said the High Court of Karnataka

title: BJP asks J&K CM to organise anti-terror rally in Srinagar
content: The Union Territory must send a clear message that every individual in J&K stands firmly against militancy, said BJP spokesperson Altaf Thakur

title: Police tracking movement of Maoists for two months in Andhra Pradesh
content: It is suspected that more than 70 Maoists have entered the State, say police, adding that combing is under way to nab those who escaped

title: SIT arrests former TDB president and CPI(M) leader A. Padmakumar in the Sabarimala gold theft case
content: Officials say SIT has reportedly indicted Mr. Padmakumar mainly for â€œbequeathingâ€ an undue financial benefit to the prime accused Unnikrishnan Potti in 2019, by presiding over the â€œwilful miscategorisationâ€ of the gilded panels as made of pure copper before entrusting them to the personal custody of the main suspect, ostensibly for restoring them to their original golden shine

title: Jaganâ€™s â€˜dramaâ€™ at CBI court unwarranted, says Varla Ramaiah
content: The TDP leader accuses the former Chief Minister of intentionally mobilising crowds to later cite law and order disturbance as an excuse to stay away from the courts

title: Biometric enrolment of 58% of Myanmar refugees in Mizoram completed
content: The exercise has been affected by poor internet connectivity, and difficulty in identifying refugees living outside designated relief camps

title: No growth in activity of eight core sectors in October 2025, worst showing in 14 months
content: Growth in the steel, cement, fertilisers and refinery products sectors was balanced out by contractions in coal, electricity, natural gas, and crude oil sectors. Â

title: Chief Minister Siddaramaiah will keep his word, says D.K. Suresh
content: In an indirect reference to the informal power-sharing pact in the State on the occasion of the government completing the first half of its full term, D.K. Suresh, former Congress MP, has said that Chief Minister Siddaramaiah will â€œkeep his wordâ€

title: AIADMK wonders why DMK opposes SIR in Tamil Nadu
content: He accuses the ruling party of using the names of the dead and the shifted as its â€œweaponâ€ every election to cast bogus votes

title: Women beat forest officers struggle as Marayur sandal division lacks basic amenities
content: There is no toilet or resting facilities for the women officers and they patrol the deep forests of the Marayur and Kanthalloor ranges unarmed

title: Railways urged to reconsider moveÂ to allow global fastâ€‘food giants at railway stations
content: Railway MinistryÂ must reconsider the decision urgently and strengthen platforms that promote traditional, nutritious, and locally sourced indigenous foods, says Centre for Innovation in Science and Social Action

title: Navy closely tracking Chinaâ€™s supply of submarines, warships to Pakistan: Vice Chief
content: Vice Admiral Sanjay Vatsayan says the Navy is fully aware of the platforms being transferred to Pakistan and is strengthening its own anti-submarine warfare capabilities accordingly

title: Nehruâ€™s 100 selected works volumes go fully online
content: Jawaharlal Nehru archive digitised with 35,000 documents and illustrations, searchable and free to download

title: 400 million children globally deprived in least two critical areas: UNICEF
content: India, home to 460 million children, is on track to reduce multi-dimensional poverty in accordance with U.N. SDG targets, says UNICEF representative on World Childrenâ€™s Day

title: College student thrashed over language row in local train ends life in Thane district
content: Police said that the teen's father has alleged that his son asked a passenger to move a little ahead in a crowded compartment, when the latter reprimanded him for not speaking in Marathi, and the matter escalated.

title: NCC music band from Kerala selected for Republic Day parade
content: Newman College team  is the first NCC menâ€™s music band from Kerala to participate in the R-Day parade

title: Bhupender Yadav holds talks with Ministers from China, Cuba, Germany, Denmark on COP sidelines
content: Negotiators from more than 190 countries have gathered here for the annual Conference of the Parties (COP) to the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC)

title: Fixing what's wrong with Liverpool, Barcelona, Juventus, more
content: the defending champions have lost five of six in league play to fall to eighth in the table . the german side have lost seven of 10 in all competitions . there are plenty of signs that players are still grieving and struggling with the death of teammate Diogo Jota .

title: Son or MÃ¼ller: Which dream MLS debut season ends this weekend?
content: the MLS Cup playoffs will feature two players who fit into the former category . MLS 's son Heung-Min and the Vancouver Whitecaps ' Thomas MÃ¼ller' will feature in the playoffs this weekend . it raises the question of why have Son and his team .

title: Survivor pool strategy: Ravens, Seahawks among top options in Week 12
content: ESPN Eliminator Challenge is one of the most fun games to play this season . the rules are simple: pick one team, and as long as they win (or tie), you advance to the next round . fewer than 6% of entrants were knocked out last week, the lowest rate in any week all season. for the season, only nine underdogs of at least six points have won outright .

title: Texas firmly out, Miami in limbo and the G5â€™s flavor of the week
content: the new rankings keep Ohio State at the top of the pile, while Texas Tech slides into the no. 5 spot in Week 13 . Notre Dame should buy some furniture and move in . the team's only win against a CFP-ranked team is against no. 15 USC .

title: Flyers to honor young cancer patients with pregame SkateSkins
content: the Philadelphia Flyers take the ice for warm-ups on friday night . it will feature both a heartwarming and history-making little detail that the players will be wearing . sign up now Philly has partnered with SkateSkins, a company that creates customizable skate accessories .

title: Inside the decision that will rock college football: What's next for Kiffin?
content: coach Lane Kiffin says there is no ultimatum for him to make a decision on his coaching future . he posted a photo of a page from Brianna Wiest's self-development book, "the Pivot Year: 365 days to Become the Person You Truly Want to Be" he encouraged readers to make two lists, one of the positivists .

title: 2026 recruiting class rankings: Ohio State, Miami, Iowa on the rise
content: a wave of commitments, decommitments and flips largely driven by three-star prospects shook up these rankings . the number of remaining undeclared prospects in the SC Next 300 is in single digits, but heading into the initial signing period for the 2026 class, many factors can still drive changes .

title: What happened to last year's AFC juggernauts? Chiefs, Ravens and Texans are all 5-5
content: defending division champions have plenty of work to do in order to reach the postseason . the Texans are thriving in the AFC, including the new England Patriots (9-2) the texans have found their franchise quarterback in Drake Maye and the Denver Broncos .

title: Buzz: Will Burrow, Daniels return? Hottest coaching candidates?
content: insiders Jeremy Fowler and Dan Graziano have been making calls to sources around the league . they got the latest intel on whether we should expect quarterbacks Joe Burrow and Jayden Daniels to get back on the field and help their teams down the stretch . burrow has been out since week 2 because of a toe injury .

title: What makes Josh Allen so dangerous? Inside his top rushing touchdowns
content: the Buffalo Bills were looking to put away the Tampa Bay Buccaneers in Week 11 . the bills moved the ball to the 9-yard line, leading 37-32 with 2:42 remaining . it was Allen's sixth touchdown and third rushing score of that game .
